alert.note: Alert for Mercer (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 6:22PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CENTRAL MERCER COUNTY THROUGH 645 PM EDT... At 621 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Geneva, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 35 mph, pea size hail, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Celina, Coldwater, St. Henry, Fort Recovery, Wabash, Burkettsville, Montezuma and Carthagena. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...35 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
